definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
rational number (i.e. fraction of two integers, math.)

pinyin: gong1 shuo1 gong1 you3 li3 , po2 shuo1 po2 you3 li3
containing_words.word: 公說公有理，婆說婆有理

pinyin: gong1 shuo1 gong1 you3 li3 , po2 shuo1 po2 you3 li3
containing_words.word: 公說公有理，婆說婆有理

definition: field of rational numbers (math.), usually denoted by Q

sentences.english: Every polynomial is differentiable , and so is every rational .
sentences.chinese: 每個多項式都是可微的，而每個有理函數也是如此。

sentences.english: Doyle insisted his finishing off Holmes was a "justifiable homicide".
sentences.chinese: 道爾堅持自己終結福爾摩斯的生命是有理有據的。

sentences.english: These remarks sound reasonable, yet in fact they are quite illogical.
sentences.chinese: 聽起來有理，其實是個因噎廢食的邏輯。

sentences.english: they proclaimed. They rebelled against everything and wreaked havoc everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 他們宣稱“造反有理”，反對一切並大肆毀滅破壞。

sentences.english: That theory is concerned with rational functions instead of just polynomials.
sentences.chinese: 該理論所研究的是有理函數而不僅是多次式。

sentences.english: Adopting geometric method, the rational function interpolation is constructed on polygonal element.
sentences.chinese: 採用幾何的方法構造出多邊形單元上的有理函數插值。

sentences.english: If you do disagree with a point that has been made, you should provide a polite and scientifically solid rebuttal.
sentences.chinese: 若你對某點持反對意見，應該禮貌並有理有據地反駁。

sentences.english: In decimal form, rational numbers are either terminating or repeating decimals.
sentences.chinese: 在十進位中，有理數的位數有限，或者可以重複。

sentences.english: MESSY end to Greece's debt crisis seems ever more plausible.
sentences.chinese: 希臘債務危機草草收場似乎比以往來得更有理有據。

sentences.english: "Enjolras and Combeferre are right, " said he;
sentences.chinese: 安灼拉和公白飛說得有理。

sentences.english: Did not believe that the defeat is rational. I will overcome a legend.
sentences.chinese: 我只要拼到底，不去相信失敗有理，我打下一個傳奇。

sentences.english: Our experience is worth of learning and applying for reference.
sentences.chinese: 文章有理有據，經驗做法具體實用，值得交流和借鑑。

sentences.english: The View Yi's Creation in "Li Exists Earlier than the Book Does".
The speaker pinned philosophy down and made it talk sense.
sentences.chinese: 發言人抓住哲學爭論的界線使其言之有理。

sentences.english: Speak calmly if you think you're in the right; there's no need to get angry.
sentences.chinese: 有理慢慢兒說，何必發脾氣。

sentences.english: Go over that contract with a fine-tooth comb before you agree to anything.
sentences.chinese: 檢查一下，在簽訂之前確定合同上各項條款通順有理。

definition: to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to be left speechless/unable to respond
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
